pullRequest.body:
Also adding `RootPairing.IsValuedIn` (together with some API) since this enables us to define an integer-valued Cartan matrix for crystallographic pairings.

More importantly, `RootPairing.IsValuedIn` is also the missing piece to generalise (and unify) some results which currently require ordered scalars such as [RootPairing.coxeterWeight_mem_set_of_isCrystallographic](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/RootSystem/Finite/CanonicalBilinear.html#RootPairing.coxeterWeight_mem_set_of_isCrystallographic) but this work is left for a future PR (mostly to simplify review).

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [73618f485a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20999/commits/73618f485af0da07bdac45a6543f1dae99ac455d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.RootSystem.CartanMatrix` (new file)|1377|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsValuedIn`
`+ IsValuedIn.trans`
`+ algebraMap_coxeterWeightIn`
`+ algebraMap_pairingIn`
`+ cartanMatrix`
`+ cartanMatrixIn`
`+ cartanMatrixIn_apply_same`
`+ cartanMatrixIn_def`
`+ coxeterWeightIn`
`+ exists_value`
`+ instance [P.IsValuedIn S] : P.flip.IsValuedIn S := by`
`+ isValuedIn_iff_mem_range`
`+ pairingIn`
`++ instance : P.IsValuedIn R`
`- IsCrystallographic.mem_range_algebraMap`
`- exists_int`
`- exists_int_eq_coxeterWeight`
`- instance [P.IsCrystallographic] : P.flip.IsCrystallographic := by`
`- isCrystallographic_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

```suggestion
  .of fun i j ↦ P.pairingIn S i j
```
This will lead to better behaviour if the definition is unfolded, because there are simp-lemmas for `Matrix.of`.
It doesn't matter too much, but I think it is nice if `i j` come after `S` in this lemma as well.

```suggestion
            simpa [← P.algebraMap_coxeterWeightIn _ _ ℤ] using P.coxeterWeight_non_neg P.RootForm i j
```

What do you think of the following slight rephrasing?
```suggestion
@[mk_iff]
class IsValuedIn (S : Type*) [CommRing S] [Algebra S R] : Prop where
  exists_value : ∀ i j, ∃ s, algebraMap S R s = P.pairing i j

protected alias exists_value := IsValuedIn.exists_value

/-- A root pairing is said to be crystallographic if the pairing between a root and coroot is
always an integer. -/
abbrev IsCrystallographic := P.IsValuedIn ℤ

section IsValuedIn

instance : P.IsValuedIn R where
  exists_value i j := by simp

variable (S : Type*) [CommRing S] [Algebra S R]

variable {S} in
lemma isValuedIn_iff_mem_range :
    P.IsValuedIn S ↔ ∀ i j, P.pairing i j ∈ range (algebraMap S R) := by
  simp only [isValuedIn_iff, mem_range]

instance : P.IsValuedIn R where
  exists_value := by simp

instance [P.IsValuedIn S] : P.flip.IsValuedIn S := by
  rw [isValuedIn_iff, forall_comm]
  exact P.exists_value

/-- A variant of `RootPairing.pairing` for root pairings which are valued in a smaller set of
coefficients.

Note that it is uniquely-defined only when the map `S → R` is injective, i.e., when we have
`[NoZeroSMulDivisors S R]`. -/
def pairingIn [P.IsValuedIn S] (i j : ι) : S :=
  (P.exists_value i j).choose

@[simp]
lemma algebraMap_pairingIn [P.IsValuedIn S] (i j : ι) :
    algebraMap S R (P.pairingIn S i j) = P.pairing i j :=
  (P.exists_value i j).choose_spec

lemma IsValuedIn.trans (T : Type*) [CommRing T] [Algebra T S] [Algebra T R] [IsScalarTower T S R]
    [P.IsValuedIn T] :
    P.IsValuedIn S where
  exists_value i j := by
    use algebraMap T S (P.pairingIn T i j)
    simp [← RingHom.comp_apply, ← IsScalarTower.algebraMap_eq T S R]
```
I'm mainly claiming that `exists_value` should get a more prominent place than the `mem_range` variant.
Huh GitHub cannot apply this as a suggestion: Applying by hand.

```suggestion
class IsValuedIn (S : Type*) [CommSemiRing S] [Algebra S R] : Prop where
```
This will allow `S = Nat`, which will be nice when stating/proving
```
P.coxeterWeightIn Nat i j ∈ ({0, 1, 2, 3, 4} : Set Nat)
```
Agreed; this might also be useful in a potential (though not currently planned) refactor of `RootPairing.Base` (which I now I think is "correct" only for crystallographic pairings).
On second thought, I don't think this will ever be useful: the pairing cannot avoid negative values (though the Coxeter weights can).

pullRequest.title: feat: define the Cartan matrix of a root pairing relative to a base
